notes.how_to_extend: To expand this syllabus: (1) split each major algorithm topic into (a) assumptions, (b) mathematical derivation, (c) implementation details, (d) diagnostics/convergence, (e) performance tricks; (2) add a dedicated track for stochastic MILP (integer recourse, branch-and-cut, scenario decomposition heuristics); (3) add a dedicated track for risk and ambiguity (CVaR, nested risk measures, distributionally robust SP); (4) attach 2–3 anchors per topic: one theory (Birge-Louveaux/Shapiro) + one implementation (Pyomo/PySP or SDDP.jl/JuMP).
